Consider the following higher-order logic statement:

∀P ∈ (ℕ → Prop), (∃a,b ∈ ℕ, P(a) ∧ P(b)) ⟹ (∃n ∈ ℕ, P(n)).

Using this statement, prove that for any property P defined on natural numbers, if there exist two numbers a and b such that P(a) and P(b), then there exists an natural number n such that P(n).
